Key Match Events: Shaedon Sharpe scored 33 points, leading the Portland Trail Blazers to a 106-98 victory over the Minnesota Timberwolves.
Donovan Clingan narrowly missed a triple-double with 17 points, 13 rebounds, and eight blocks.
Anthony Edwards scored 24 points for the Timberwolves.
Portland took control in the fourth quarter behind Clingan's defense, who had four blocks in the period.
Shaedon Sharpe's put-back slam dunk with 5:26 left in the game put Portland up 91-83.
Pre-Game Insights: Minnesota played without starting point guard Mike Conley, who was rested as part of a bigger plan for the 37-year-old point guard.
Portland was without starting point guard Anfernee Simons, who left Tuesday's game with shortness of breath.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Minnesota shot 7 for 39 (18%) from the 3-point line, despite being ranked fourth in the NBA in 3-point percentage.
